ticket.title: config.gem in environment.rb to allow no-rdoc and no-ri options
ticket.original-body: Currently config.gem in environment.rb doesn't take no-ri and no-rdoc options, resulting in unwanted documentation's being installed along with dependent gems on production machines -- lacking such options discourages usage of this nice Rails feature!

version.body:
There's a pretty easy way to solve this problem via a ~/.gemrc or /etc/gemrc file.
Output from "gem help env":
The RubyGems environment can be controlled through command line arguments, gemrc files, environment variables and built-in defaults.
Command line argument defaults and some RubyGems defaults can be set in ~/.gemrc file for individual users and a /etc/gemrc for all users. A gemrc is a YAML file with the following YAML keys:
:sources: A YAML array of remote gem repositories to install gems from :verbose: Verbosity of the gem command. false, true, and :really are the levels :update_sources: Enable/disable automatic updating of repository metadata :backtrace: Print backtrace when RubyGems encounters an error :bulk_threshold: Switch to a bulk update when this many sources are out of date (legacy setting) :gempath: The paths in which to look for gems gem_command: A string containing arguments for the specified gem command
Example:
:verbose: false install: --no-wrappers update: --no-wrappers
version.body-html:
There's a pretty easy way to solve this problem via a ~/.gemrc or /etc/gemrc file.

Output from "gem help env":

The RubyGems environment can be controlled through command line arguments,
gemrc files, environment variables and built-in defaults.

Command line argument defaults and some RubyGems defaults can be set in
~/.gemrc file for individual users and a /etc/gemrc for all users.  A gemrc
is a YAML file with the following YAML keys:

  :sources: A YAML array of remote gem repositories to install gems from
  :verbose: Verbosity of the gem command.  false, true, and :really are the
            levels
  :update_sources: Enable/disable automatic updating of repository metadata
  :backtrace: Print backtrace when RubyGems encounters an error
  :bulk_threshold: Switch to a bulk update when this many sources are out of
                   date (legacy setting)
  :gempath: The paths in which to look for gems
  gem_command: A string containing arguments for the specified gem command

Example:

  :verbose: false
  install: --no-wrappers
  update: --no-wrappers
